wikipedia_page.main: Peter Chisman (8 September 1940 – 23 October 2003) was a British racing cyclist who won the Tour of Britain - known then as the Milk Race - in 1963. He led the race from beginning to end. He also rode in the 1967 Tour de France.

response: *Pete Chisman, 63, British cyclist, complications from surgery.1963 Milk Race winner Peter Chisman dies
